title: EastEnders' Beppe di Marco star Michael Greco looks unrecognisable in new snaps
text:

It's been 21 years since Beppe and his husky voice left Albert Square behind.

Michael Greco played the role of Walford sleazebag Beppe Di Marco in BBC soap EastEnders until 2002 and became one of TV's most in-demand hunks.

The now 48-year-old then went on to star in Casualty in 2017 as a handsome policeman, but has now taken to Instagram and shocked fans with his older looks.

The actor regularly shares snaps of his lavish lifestyle and sun-soaked holidays, but his latest clip showed off his ageing features.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: Instagram)

During the video, Michael talks about his latest health kick and jokes that he looks like comedian Harry Hill while exaggeratedly patting his thinning hair and flaunting his handsome looks.

He says: "Oh my god! I look like Harry Hill!"

His trademark goatee that caused dedicated fans to swoon in the past has now transformed into a well maintained beard, and his once-brunette locks are a thing of the past.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

After leaving Albert Square back in 2002, the heartthrob actor was voted the sexiest male soap star ever by Radio Times.

Michael first joined EastEnders back in 1998 but was axed by executive producer John Yorke in 2002 as he set to "revamp the show" with his final scene airing on 4 June later that year.

While taking a break from acting, Michael then threw himself into a tough exercise regime after he ditched the UK for Los Angeles over a decade ago.

During an appearance on Loose Women in 2016, the ex soap star sent hearts fluttering when he talked about his new ripped physique.

(Image: BBC)

The star is now officially back in the UK and looking for new ventures. Fans on social media have commented on the star's transformed look.

One questioned: "OMG is that Beppe from Eastenders?"

While another one commented on a ten year challenge snap Michael posted in January.

Michael shared two images side-by-side alongside the caption: "This is my 10 year Challenge. It doesn’t matter how we have changed our appearance and how we look on the outside."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: Instagram)

He continued: "It’s far more important how we have changed on the inside. Be kind. Smile and be happy.

"Life is beautiful and life is precious. Stay healthy and love your friends and family with all your heart."

The fan praised: "You look exactly the same!! Wicked!!"

Another dedicated fan complimented the soap star: "Like a fine wine, gets better with age, but always makes my heart skip a beat."
description: He won the hearts of the nation for playing Beppe di Marco in EastEnders in the nineties, but looks completely different now
